page.title: 19LANDSCAPE IN BALFRON AREA
page.content: The{landscape}in the Balfron area is dominated by hills- to the South by the glaciated, grass-covered{Campsie {Fells}with their distinctive corries, and to the North and West by the more mountainous Highlands. Hidden from the village by trees, the River Endrick flows from East to West through the area on its way to Loch Lomond. In fact, the area is characterised by the many{trees}which border the narrow, twisting roads and pervade the grasslands of the farms and estates. The village of Balfron is spread out over the slope with a pleasing blend of old and{new buildings.}The local red sandstone has been used for the{older buildings}and this contrasts well with the many white-painted buildings. The overall scene is one of unspoilt rural tranquility.
